pl.edu.icm.cermine.structure

Class ITextCharacterExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.edu.icm.cermine.structure.ITextCharacterExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharacterExtractor

    public class ITextCharacterExtractor
extends Object
implements CharacterExtractor
    Extracts text chunks from PDFs along with their position on the page, width and height.
    Author:
    Dominika Tkaczyk (d.tkaczyk@icm.edu.pl)

    • Method Detail

      • extractCharacters

        public BxDocument extractCharacters(InputStream stream)
                             throws AnalysisException
        Extracts text chunks from PDF using iText and stores them in BxDocument object. Depending on parsed PDF, extracted text chunks may or may not be individual glyphs, they correspond to single string operands of PDF's text-showing operators (Tj, TJ, ' and ").
        Specified by:
        extractCharacters in interface CharacterExtractor
        Parameters:
        stream - PDF's stream
        Returns:
        BxDocument containing pages with extracted chunks stored as BxChunk lists
        Throws:
        AnalysisException - AnalysisException

      • getBackPagesLimit

        public int getBackPagesLimit()

      • getFrontPagesLimit

        public int getFrontPagesLimit()

      • setPagesLimits

        public void setPagesLimits(int frontPagesLimit,
                           int backPagesLimit)
        Sets the number of front and back pages to be processed and returned. If any of the values is set to 0 or less, the whole document is processed. This may cause long processing time for large documents.
        Parameters:
        frontPagesLimit - front pages limit
        backPagesLimit - back pages limit
